item.title: Abandoned car for weeks, 15th June
item.description:
Outside 2 Jersey Avenue for 4 weeks missing wing mirror not moved once. I’m trying to get gully fixed but can’t find owner asked on various sites with no response. Looks like it’s been abandoned. Gully request info Web Reference: 7712799 Enquiry Number: 22080433 Smells like sewerage plant outside no 2 & no 4 Jersey Avenue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Kings Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole or surface erosion area where the top layer of asphalt has worn away, 15th June
item.description:
A pothole or surface erosion area where the top layer of asphalt has worn away, exposing loose gravel and small stones underneath. Loose gravel and broken asphalt pieces are visible. The pothole is relatively shallow but could worsen over time with traffic and weather.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Ansell Close, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Stench from gully - been told it needs to be capped, 15th June
item.description:

item.title: Overnight damage to tarmac laid on 6 June by heavy vehicle - now causing trip hazard, 15th June
item.description:
Severn Trent worked on a water meter outside 8 New Barn Close on 6 June 2025. The area on the pavement was tarmacked by their contractors and left in good and smooth order. During the evening or night of 14th to 15th June a heavy vehicle drove onto the pavement and caused noticeable damage with a broken tarmac surface and raised ridge which is now a trip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, New Barn Close, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Well Place never cleaned., 15th June
item.description:
The parking in Well Placd is for a six hour limit. It’s a favourite ‘wait zone’ for taxis but other parked vehicles also us the street as a public rubbish bin when they park up, eat lunch & then deposit litter & contents of car ashtrays in the gutters. The street is never cleaned. I ‘litter pick’ as required & sweep the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Well Place, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous Junction, 15th June
item.description:
The five way junction of Douro Road, Malvern Place, Well Place & Lansdown Parade has lost most of its markings - it’s a dangerous junction especially for pedestrians & cars emerging from Well Place you…….. traffic does not ‘give way’ when emerging from Lansdown Parade.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Malvern Place, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The new pavement in West Approach Drive has no kerb and cars are mounting the pavement., 14th June
item.description:
West Approach Drive was given a new pavement along with the Evesham Road cycle lane. This road is the main approach to the Pump Room which is the premier building in Cheltenham. The new pavement is very shoddy. It is only wide enough for one pedestrian and has no kerb. Consequently cars that are doing u turns at the end of West Approach Drive ( a cul de sac) are continually mounting the pavement. This is dangerous for pedestrians and ruins the grass area. See picture. The quality of construction of the pavement is very shabby for such an important road and a kerb need to be constructed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Approach Drive, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
